heaviest_rainfall.status: On 09 November 2025, a record rainfall of 47.89mm was measured, indicating an exceptionally wet day.  24.6mm per hour was recorded as falling at times during the 144.8 hour storm.

heaviest_rainrate.status: On 02 September 2025, the rain fell at an exceptional rate, peaking at 34.3mm per hour, the heaviest downpour recorded.  A total of 21.19mm fell over the 15.0 hour storm.

longest_rain.status: The record duration for continuous rain was set on 09 November 2025, the storm lasted 144.8 hours with a total precipitation of 47.89mm and it reached 24.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 02 February 2026, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is currently no cold snap.  This year there have been 3 cold snaps, usually there are 3.6 cold snaps per year.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 0 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (202°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 128.2 mph on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 1.6°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 1.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 110 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 213 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 110.1m lower than yesterday, 159.3m lower than the past week, 212.6m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 604m to a maximum of 818m, averaging 572.8m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 732.2m and 785.4m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and little or no wind. Showers, fog or low cloud is expected, and weak sunlight because of clouds. Low pressure may lead to stormy or rainy weather.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (94%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
